b:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold mb-6","children":"The Guarantee (Garantía) Challenge"}],["$","div",null,{"className":"prose prose-lg max-w-none text-muted-foreground","children":[["$","p",null,{"className":"mb-4","children":"One of the biggest challenges for expats is the \"garantía\" - a property guarantee required by most landlords. Traditionally, this means having a local property owner co-sign your lease, which is impossible for most foreigners."}],["$","p",null,{"className":"mb-4","children":["$","strong",null,{"children":"Alternatives include:"}]}],["$","ul",null,{"className":"list-disc pl-6 mb-4 space-y-2","children":[["$","li",null,{"children":"Paying a larger security deposit (3-6 months)"}],["$","li",null,{"children":"Using a garantía insurance company (seguro de caución)"}],["$","li",null,{"children":"Finding landlords who accept international guarantees"}],["$","li",null,{"children":"Working with expat-friendly agencies"}],["$","li",null,{"children":"Airbnb or temporary housing while you build local connections"}]]}],["$","p",null,{"children":"Many landlords are becoming more flexible with foreigners, especially if you can show proof of stable foreign income and pay several months upfront."}]]}]]}]}]}]
